result.execSummary:
The defendant Samantha A Eggers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Samantha A Eggers

records.addlTxt: Duplicate Original Warrant returned from JCSD
FINANCIAL NOTES:  Bookkeeping Screen Prints
Reminder Notice--Final Notice

The Court orders that: Upon deposit of $200.00 (posted with letter) the failure to pay commitment shall be canceled.  The Defendant shall pay the remaining balance, plus interest and a $15.00 payment plan fee at the rate of $30.00/month commencing 03/31/2017.  25% annual increase of monthly payments shall be implemented.  Civil judgment and referral to the WI DOR, if applicable, shall remain .  Any failure to comply with this payment order shall result it the re-imposition of the failure to pay sentence without further notice of hearing. Endorsed by the Court on 02/28/2017.
Per the 02/28/2017 order
from the Defendant regarding warrant and requesting to to be put back on a payment plan
FINANCIAL NOTES:  Bookkeeping Screen Prints
Reminder Notice
with Elements and CCS

[MK] case called at 1:07pm. 
Defendant Samantha A Eggers in court with Attorney Whitney Hagemann.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance; there is no request to be heard.
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " No Contest " entered; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

The Court sentences Ms. Eggers to pay a fine of $100 + costs = $679 to be paid in $30 per month installments commencing on 10/15/16 and on the 15th day of each month thereafter until paid in full. Non-payment shall result in a 13 days jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive.
The Court orders DNA sample provision. 
Days credit for time already served:  1 day. 
recess 1:39pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 15, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Bond signed on 7/20/2016 and received by COC on 7/21/2016

Case called at 3:22pm [mo]
Defendant Samantha A Eggers in court, in custody with Attorney Whitney Hagemann.   Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court considers the warrant to be executed and should be removed from any database in which it remains, as it has now been served.

Atty. Hagemann gives explanation for Ms. Eggers non-appearance.

Bond arguments given by Counsel.

The questions Ms. Eggers.

The Court reinstates Ms. Eggers signature bond, amount and non-monetary conditions remain, the Court adds one condition which is that Ms. Eggers is to remain in constant and diligent contact with Atty. Hagemann.

The Court instructs that Ms. Eggers' notices/mailings be sent to her mother's address: 747 E. Racine St., Jefferson.

Atty. Hagemann requests that a plea/sentencing be scheduled out 3 weeks.
recess: 3:35pm

NEXT: Plea and Sentencing on 8/15/16 at 1:00pm
Per JCSD defendant will appear at intake tomorrow 7/20/16 // Duplicate Original Warrant document returned from JCSD

[Scheduled for FSSC]

Case called at 4:06pm [mo]
Attorney Whitney Hagemann in court.   DA Susan Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. Hagemann has no explanation for Ms. Eggers non appearance
The Court directs that the warrant remain in effect
The Court directs the Clerk to remove the jury trial from the Court's calendar.
recess: 4:07pm

[Scheduled for Motion Hearing]

Case called at 1:51pm [mo]
Defendant Samantha A Eggers does NOT appear in court.
Attorney Whitney Hagemann appears.  ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Upon inquiry of the Court, ADA Shock indicates that Ms. Eggers has not been fully accepted into FOP
Atty. Hagemann has no explanation for Ms. Eggers non appearance.

The Court issues a bench warrant, if Ms. Eggers is taken into custody she may be released upon posting $500 CASH.
The Court maintains the FSSC and Jury Trial dates at this time. 
recess: 1:55pm

Case called at 1:23pm  [sf] [Judge Koschnick presiding for Branch II)
Defendant Samantha A Eggers in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Whitney Hageman from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office. Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Public Defenders Office appears for bond purposes only, defendant does not qualify.
Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant.
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $500.00 signature bond, with conditions: 
-No acts or threats of violence towards any person
-No presence at 121 W. Main St. in Watertown
-No discussion of the facts of the case with Samuel Martin; no one on Ms. Eggers behalf can discuss the facts of the case with Mr. Martin except an attorney

Recess: 1:28 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
PTC: 11/11/15 at 9:00 am
Status: 12/29/15 at 8:30 am
